elements.title: Atari 810 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first drive available for the Atari 8-bit family, the Atari 810 floppy disk drive (pictured), was described as "noisy, slow and inefficient", with "notoriously poor speed regulation"?

elements.title: no three pawns lie on the same line (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that one can place 16 pawns on a chessboard such that no three pawns lie on the same line?

elements.title: Mauatua (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Mauatua married the Bounty mutineer Fletcher Christian and ensured women on Pitcairn were given the vote?

elements.title: Cytosis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the board game Cytosis was endorsed by the Journal of Cell Science?

elements.title: Óscar Catacora (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Óscar Catacora directed Wiñaypacha (Eternity), the first Peruvian film in the Aymara language?

elements.title: Dick in a Box (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Asa Taccone was paid just $60 for co-editing and co-writing the Lonely Island's "Dick in a Box"?

elements.title: Randal Plunkett, 21st Baron of Dunsany (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that filmmaker Randal Plunkett, 21st Baron of Dunsany, has seen the return of many species of bird and plant, as well as pine martens, stoats and otters, to his ancestral lands with rewilding?

elements.title: Claremont Park (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the black swamp in Claremont Park was believed to be inhabited by evil spirits and was known to have consumed cattle?
